CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 13, 1946, pg. 17, reads: "Kiddie Party - The Fourth of July was a double treat to John Nelson Jr., who was [illegible]...years old. A number of his tot friends attended a birthday party in his honor at his home at 2224 Tustin Street.  His father, John Sr., will soon be home from serving with the armed forces in the South Pacific. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: John Nelson Jr. licking birthday cake icing off of knife, surrounded by boys and girls, at birthday party in Nelson home, 2224 Tustin Street, Hill District
